explanation: Agent A is correct. Rule 14.2(3) requires the third clause to modify only the loop counter and not to use any object that is modified in the loop body. In the code the third clause is off += (size_t) ret, and the identifier ret is assigned inside the loop body (ret = send(...); and ret = 0 when EAGAIN). Therefore the third clause uses an object that is modified in the loop body, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2. A compliant fix is to avoid using a body-modified object in the third clause (for example do the increment inside the loop body or rewrite as a while loop).
